basics.name: Darius DeSpain
basics.label: Software Engineer | Transitioning Servicemember | Active TS/SCI Security Clearance
basics.summary: Transitioning Servicemember who has a passion for solving technical problems and creating quality software to improve the lives of others. Seeking a Full-Stack Software Engineer role in the Northern Colorado Region with a start date of 28 October 2024. Active TS/SCI Security Clearance

work.summary: Full-Stack Software Engineer (Front End and Back End). Collaborated with the product team to enhance our web app frontend and RESTful APIs through pair programming/application development, problem-solving, and communication. Participated in and occasionally facilitated agile ceremonies. Position obtained through the DoD SkillBridge program during transition from Active Duty to civilian life
highlights: Architected and implemented acceptance testing with Playwright/Docker Compose; optimized Cypress tests in Surefire
Developed 9+ full-stack features for Tracer and Surefire, including injesting CSV uploads and multi-demensional tables
Integrated code via Git CLI, GitHub Actions/GitLab CI/CD pipelines, Sonarqube, and Pull/Merge Requests
Wrote unit (JUnit/React Testing Library/Jest) and e2e tests (Playwright/Cypress) using Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Implemented Git Hooks for pre-commit/push checks, ensuring code quality and adherence to Conventional Commits
Developed in VS Code and IntelliJ IDEA; managed environments with CLI, YAML, Docker, AWS EC2, and ECR
Troubleshooted staging with ArgoCD, managing Kubernetes pod states and deployments
Converted 10+ JavaScript files to TypeScript to prevent UI runtime errors
Collaborated with team members to create Architecture/Design Documents to capture the Technical Design of Tracer
Wrote Python scripts (with SQl queries) to seed development data in MySQL database

work.summary: Responsible for leading the software development technical team at Space Delta 8 (Del 8), designing and implementing software product development to enable the warfighters at Delta 8 so they can implement digital and technical tools into their daily lives, and assisting the CDT director in program management for Del 8's software portfolio. Also fostered communication and collaboration with stakeholders, end-users, and technical team
highlights: Digitized operations requests with MOR Tool, launching organization's first in-house software. Chaired 10 stakeholder meetings, coded 7 features, eliminating hard copies for requests. Awarded Junior Officer of Q1/2023

Converted legacy full-stack application to low-code/no-code application on Warp Core, the USSF's instantiation of Palantir Foundry, using Workshop, custom TypeScript functions, Pipeline Builder, Ontology, and Datasets
Developed code using VS Code and pair programming, managed enivronments with bash/PowerShell/Vagrant/Docker
Wrote unit (React Testing Library/Enzyme/Jest) and end-to-end/acceptance tests (Cypress)
Troubleshooted staging issues using ArgoCD to manage Kubernetes pod states and deployments
Integrated code with Git CLI, GitLab-CI/CD-Pipelines, including Sonarqube/Forify/Anchor scans, and Merge Requests

work.summary: Full-Stack Developer assigned to the MOR Tool product team responsible for technical implementation for our application
highlights: Developed rich text editor and PDF generator for MOR tool, enabling 100 new users
Developed code with VS Code and pair programming; managed environments with bash/PowerShell/Vagrant/Docker
Integrated code using Git CLI, GitLab CI/CD Pipelines, including Sonarqube/Forify/Anchor scans, and Merge Requests
Wrote unit (Enzyme/Jest) and end-to-end/acceptance tests (Cypress)

work.summary: Identified and coordinated preventative and reactive maintenance actions on 11 protected military communications satellites
highlights: Chaired working-groups to trend satellite health and potential preventative actions
Reviewed and approved 2 major satellite software updates (written in C++) to improve satellite capabilities
On-call engineering support for 4SOPS operators

topics: Agile Software Development (Java with Extreme Programming)
Various Computer Science and Computer Engineering topics
projects: Automatic Water Bottle Filler (Arduino Uno + C)

education.institution: Air Force Institute of Technology, WPAFB, Ohio
education.area: Advanced Cyber Education - An immersion course to hacking

volunteer.summary: Professional military and aerospace education association in support of the Air and Space Forces
highlights: Event Protocol Deputy for Warfare Symposiums and Air Space and Cyber Conferences, Sep 2019 - Present
Member, Jan 2016 - Present

volunteer.summary: Organization has STEM programs for K-12 students to create excitement and experience in the realm of technical problem solving
highlights: Mentor, FIRST Robotics Team 4068, Aug 2021 - Apr 2023
Mentor, FIRST Robotics Team 3008, Jun 2015 - Apr 2018
Various volunteer positions at local FIRST events
